content.description: Unfortunately this is the only actual boulder problem on this huge block. The crux is getting up on to the slab after climbing the short overhang.Â
content.location: SDS on opposing sidepull pockets a few feet left of the lower right corner of the overhanging north face below the slab. Climb up and left on more pockets, and just before the poorly placed tree blocks further progress make a long reach up to a hueco at the lip of the slab. Further progress requires a tricky mantel to get up on to the slab because there are no higher holds to ease the transition, only smooth rock. Once this is negotiated scramble up the slab to the top.

content.description: This massive block features a beautiful clean slab that at first glance appears to hold lots of potential...unfortunately it's so low angle that it can be scrambled up in approach shoes. The downhill side does feature a short gently overhanging face with one problem.
